answers.answer: I'm pretty certain your husband is on some sort of medication but you failed to mention them. Certain meds will turn patients into diabetics. You may also check with your pharmacist to see if certain combination of meds will increase glucose levels. First thing to do is check this Web site http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/druginformation.html

question: We can't seem to get my husbands blood sugar under control after his  bypass surgery.  Before surgery it was never out of control, it was usually about 115.  It is now anywhere from 188 to 301. He wasn't eating very much in hospital. Now his appetite is starting to come back.  He has only been home one day ffrom hospital.  Surgery was 8 days ago.  They gave him insulin during surgery, which he had never had before.  Now he takes his regulas glipizide and now insulin.  What can we do to get it back under control?This discussion is related tohttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/385618.
title: type 2 diabetes after heart bypass surgery
